pros: One of the most attractive things about OSH is the opportunity for growth. For those willing to learn and put in the work you will excel. The current leadership team is the best it’s been. They have made great strides to incentivize the member and employee experience. There’s a place for those looking to expand in their career.
cons: OSH has come a long way and will continue to move forward. Any previous concerns have been addressed and/or resolved.

pros: This place is horrid to work for.
cons: Do not work here ever!!!

job_title: Member Support Specialist in Irving, TX
pros: You get a chance to work remotely
cons: Constantly changing job description without being compensated, no overtime, no annual raises or bonuses, benefits suck your PTO is your sick time. Run!!! Run!!! Run!!!

pros: The work isn’t too bad
cons: You don’t have much room to grow

review_title: Contract Position into Full Time Employee
pros: Wonderful Management, Great Co-Workers, Its not just a job but a family, everyone is so welcoming from day one, they give back to our local communities, and the pay raise I received after becoming a full time employee.
cons: I have no negative comments, other then not being able to work at the office with these great people.

job_title: Expense Sharing Support in Coppell, TX
pros: Atleast you'll have a job
cons: Benefits are horrible starting with dental. The high turnover rate speaks for it self. I was there only 6momths and watched 2 managers quit, team leads telling me the job was stressful and was looking elsewhere. A director quit after working in pur department for 1 day. Three ppl contracted covid and hr tried to hide it from us. Luckily the ppl informed us and everyone got checked.

review_title: Great people, a diamond in the rough
pros: Fantastic staff and community. There are some people here that are a true joy to work with. It is a small company, so if you like that intimate culture, you will find it here. Leadership is incredibly transparent and open to feedback. There is a strong culture of trust here.
cons: Because it is such a young company, there are still a lot of growing pains going on. There's a lot of technical hurdles being dealth with that, until they are settled, can make life for some staff kind of difficult. However leadership is aware of these issues and are working to get them fixed as quickly as reality will allow them to.

pros: The people were nice, but some seemed fake.
cons: They lie about overtime hours, promise gift cards that they do not send you and refuse to communicate when I need my Pay Stubs and Final Check.

pros: I joined the OneShare Health family on June 7, 2021. I report directly to the new CEO as his Executive Administrator. He's awesome! Since day 1, I've been engaged in all levels of organizational discussions and empowered to make decisions. I've been encouraged to express my ideas and asked for my opinion which is huge for me. I feel valued and believe my hard work is appreciated. The benefits/compensation package is excellent and everyone here is very friendly and happy to help me. I'm very grateful for the opportunity!
cons: Due to Covid, many employees continue to work remotely. I hope that changes soon and I get to personally meet all of our Team members.

pros: pay better than average market, small team and fun people
cons: lack of communication, no hourly raises since I started and always changing things.

pros:
Great Management team
Normal work hours
Great home/work-life balance
cons: Some of the former management left a bad mark on the company but they have since left and the new management has been much better.

pros: I do not have the words to describe, wait no pros
cons: Poor representation of what a company should be to it’s employees.

pros: I work with some of the best people possible. Eager to learn and share their knowledge.
cons: Due to covid we have had staff cut backs, makes work sometimes over whelming, but doable

review_title: Open and welcoming place to work
pros: The company makes a point to be transparent in communications with us, even addressing rumors and difficult questions in our monthly town halls. They have also presented a welcoming and family-like environment from the beginning. This extends to our members as well. All are welcome to join that agree with our statement of beliefs.
cons: There have been some clunky processes and too many departments at one point. This has recently been improved by combining two teams and boosting the staff numbers.

pros:
Christian Ministry 
Caring 
Understanding 
Coaching and Mentoring 
Growth
cons: Company is still new and going through change management

job_title: Member Support Team Lead in Irving, TX
pros: decent money if you have healthcare background
cons: high turnover, expensive benefits, apathetic HR team, poor management, zero communication until changes have already happened, management expects way too much of someone in a team lead position when there are supervisors and managers above them.

job_title: Member Service Representative in Irving, TX
pros: Small Employer. Does not ask employees to reveal personal health information to remain employed
cons: Still growing and with growing there will be growing pains.

review_title: Company may not be around in 30days , CEO was terminated and no Future plans
job_title: State Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Has low cost Healthshare programs for members and pays high commissions to brokers and call centers
cons: Lots of brokers are dropping the program and don't want to seel the program anymore because OneShare either does not pay the doctor and hospital bills or they take a year or longer to pay these sharings. Not good for Brokers or Members. Makes other Healthshare plan look bad as an industry.

review_title: OneShare Health is filled with humble, faith-driven, hardworking individuals that share the same goal.
pros: Family, Collaborative, Supportive, Culture, Fun
cons: Fast Paced, Last Minute Communications,

pros: Everyone is working together to take care f each other and members. Leadership is new and seem to truly want to help make the ministry great.

pros: Great benefits as well as work from home opportunity
cons: Not great with communication within the company

pros: Met exceptionally talented former employees that have a more impressive education with a higher level of business acumen and expertise than any executive leadership at the company which is why all of those employees were released.
cons: Too many too list and unfortunately due to the nature anything stated would be defamatory, therefore, decline to make any additional comments.

pros: Kind people with a lot of motivation to better the company and help it's employees

pros: You will not have to work weekends

review_title: Legitimate Health Care Sharing Ministry that Values Its Workforce
job_title: Senior Copywriter and Editor in Irving, TX
pros: Since the beginning, I've found OneShare Health's culture to be uplifting, inclusive, and incredibly supportive. By far, this is the best corporate environment I've worked in, and the leadership is outstanding. Until OneShare, I'd never had a relationship with, let alone a personal encounter with, anyone on the C-Suite Team; now, I get to interact with these individuals almost daily, and I can honestly say I've never felt so valued as an employee. In addition to the culture, I've also been very pleased with OneShare's ability to adapt to the Shelter in Place order. Working remotely has been nearly seamless (even technology wakes up on the wrong side of the bed some days) and communication has been pretty flawless.
cons: I'm hard-pressed to list any cons at this point - I've had such a positive experience. The only pain point that comes to mind is the occasional tech glitch, which IT is always quick to resolve.

review_title: One Share Health truly cares about their employees!
job_title: Member Loyalty Specialist in Uniontown, OH
pros: The work schedule is wonderful, and I have spent more time with family and friends. One Share Health truly cares about their employees and are more than accommodating with PTO requests and schedule changes! This is not the kind of company that asks you to carry the burden of working on your shoulders after walking out the door at the end of your shift. I have never felt over worked or stressed out coming into the office and genuinely love my job!
cons: Sometimes it can be difficult to get a question answered because we have so many working parts of the organization. All departments have specific job functions and at times it can be difficult to narrow down who an issue needs to be presented to resolve a member's call.

pros: OneShare Health cares about its employees in a way that is unlike any other company. They truly treat you like more than just an employee. While working at OneShare Health, I can honestly say that I enjoy each day. The management at OneShare is amazing and always goes well above and beyond normal expectations. OneShare provides you with a unique opportunity to work with amazing team members and leaders. I've learned so much from my experience working at OneShare Health. It's great to work with such amazing teams that support you and help you develop your skills. It's been an awesome experience and I couldn't have asked for better teammates and leaders!
cons: There's none at all that I could even think of.

review_title: OneShare Health is a company that cares
pros: I'm pretty new to the concept of Health Sharing but have been working in a Health Care sales environment for awhile. OneShare has a lot of perks both as an employer and for the consumer (or Members in our case). My interview process was thorough but pleasant and my first couple of weeks of training were similar. They give thorough training and support at OneShare. So far I'm overall really happy with the work, compensation, benefits, and co-workers.
cons: There's a lot to learn and the pace is quick. Not for the faint of heart but for those who enjoy challenges.

job_title: Director of Finance in Irving, TX
pros: A unique organization that truly puts employees and members first.  Our leadership is comprised of the most caring group of visionaries I've had the privilege to work with!  Our culture is at the forefront and all decisions are made with open hearts and minds, always.  Success is celebrated, struggles are nurtured and concern for each other is encouraged and supported.  Providing staff with needed resources is a top priority as is providing top notch customer service for our members.
cons: This organization growing at lightning speeds.  If you re looking for a position this is layed-back, where you can cruise through your day, this is probably not the place for you.

review_title: It's not easy being different, but it's worth it
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Irving, TX
pros: So customer-service is never a walk in the park. People 99% have a problem that they're already heated about. What makes the difference when working at a company is the resources you have to try and make the customer (or in our case Members) happy. OneShare has invested in SalesForce, has initial and ongoing training, and a pretty good management team who knows what they're doing. That makes the difference.
cons: Members aren't always aware of what they're a part of, so educating is important and takes patience

review_title: Community based products and Company Culture
pros: This group of workers are all so eager to improve and move the needle. I love the sense of collaboration, the support that each team provides each other, and the ability to honestly push back when expectations need to be level set. Love the team, love the culture, and the start-up mentality continues to present learning opportunities and career-growth.
cons: In need of a plan that cross-functional teams could follow - lots of ad hoc project work and product development can impede on progress at times.

review_title: Positive place to work, lots of changes
pros: Lots of opportunity for advancement in a short period of time. The growth just in 6 months has been impressive. The call center has a good atmosphere, like a family.  Training is accessible and helpful.  The employees are great to work with for the most part. It's a young company so change is everpresent, but that isn't a bad thing. They are always working to improve processes.
cons: It's hard to get a hold of certain departments, most likely due to understaffing. Communication between departments isn't always great. Intermittent negativity around changes and related expectations.

review_title: A Job that you can feel great about
pros: Few career decisions have left me feeling this fulfilled. I'm currently enjoying a world-class team, heavily invested leadership, great perks, benefits, pay-rates, and services that help our fellow man. I prefer a work environment where my voice and opinion is heard and OneShare has that.
cons: Those who don't quite see the vision have a hard time understanding where we're going, we need more big picture presentations

pros: Someone who just started asked me if everyone who works here is as truly happy to be here as they seem.   I quickly replied YES!!!   I have worked at other organizations who claim to put the people first.  OneShare actually practice what they preach.   Fast paced but not overwhelming.  You are surrounded by a wonderful collection of talented people who care about what they do.
cons: Nothing bad to say about working here.

pros: I'm really enjoying the experience so far. The pandemic has really proven to show some challenges but luckily our management team has found ways to overcome them. They're a thoughtful and creative team who are all problem solvers
cons: None to report yet... But I'll update with another review if that changes drastically.

pros: I only recently started this position. I was laid off during quarantine and I'm so happy I found this position. The changes have been a little hectic but I have faith it will all work out. The pay and benefits are decent and the chance to make a little extra is always nice. Overall, I can't complain.
cons: The company has some obvious growing pains but nothing too serious.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Irving, TX
pros: Customer service is not always the easiest or the most glamourous department to be in but the appreciation here makes up for it. I've never been thanked so often for my hard work as I have here. It makes a huge difference for me and my team.
cons: Haven't found any yet, I'll have to update later

review_title: I love going to work every day!
pros: Great culture, excellent onboarding and training of new hires that included meeting with all departments to introduce team and inform what piece of the puzzle they do.   OneShare Health values employee engagement, continuous improvement and feedback.   Great organization to work for and support their mission.
cons: Take the Freeport exit because the Beltine Exit backs up to the hwy.

pros: Call Center VP, Director and Managers are awesome , Marketing VP is super nice and IT rocks. However, they run into issues getting anywhere based on other departments.
cons: Only 2 weeks PTO, no sick days available have to use PTO, often work through lunch, a lot of drama and more office politics than most companies. Insurance isn't extremely good and really expensive.  People are constantly stressed, crying or giving attitude towards each other.  Promotions are far and few between. Looking at other reviews seems as though they asked specific individuals to go and write good reviews to help the company out.

job_title: On Boarding Specialist in Irving, TX
pros: Great people, good atmosphere, everyone is nice and friendly- weekly fun events-lots of encouragement and support. Prayer is welcome and open
cons: This is a new company so there are a lot of moving parts- if you don like change- this may not be there place fore you. People work hard and take their roles serious...

job_title: Member Support Specialist in Uniontown, OH
pros: The pay, people that work here, management (always there to help), the hours.
cons: I do wish the hours were 9am-5pm, but I understand why they're not! This is not really a "con" to me.

pros: This is one of the few corporate work environments where I don't merely feel like a number. My ideas and my opinion are heard and taken into consideration.
cons: It's growing so there are obvious growing pains, but even with that the teams are always working for the best outcome.

pros: The unique perspective and positioning of the company. You often end your day with a sense of accomplishment.
cons: Lots of work during this period of growth but that's the way business works. Don't join a great sales team if you like "boring."

review_title: This is one of the best places I've ever worked.
pros: Good pay, good hours and doing good, doesn't get much better than that!
cons: OSH is still a newer company and so there's some growing pains.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Irving, TX
pros: I've only been at OneShare a short time but I already love it! I love my team and my managers. Everyone loves what they do and you can really tell. It's very inspiring to work here.
cons: None yet... But I'll report back

job_title: Director of Implementation/Project Management in Irving, TX
pros: Amazing company culture and co-workers, ability to provide input and be a part of a young organization where I can learn from my peers industry experience
cons: I have no cons as this organization adapts to change and provides employees the tools needed to be successful.

review_title: No doubt, the best culture in the industry
job_title: Director of Training in Irving, TX
pros: The culture is one of a kind and the customer service is top notch. This truly is an affordable option for healthcare! I love my OneShare family and sincerely enjoy coming to work each day.
cons: I have not  had an issue yet.

review_title: Awsome energetic innovative place to work

pros: I enjoy the collaboration and pace that this company moves. They are always looking to improve and make a difference for their members.
cons: Working remotely can be difficult to build relationships with co-workers

job_title: Client Experience Team in Irving, TX
pros: The team is dedicated to growth and becoming the best in class provider for Health Sharing Ministries.
